Thiersteinia


Classification: Mesozoic -> Arkhangelskiales -> Arkhangelskiellaceae -> Thiersteinia
Sister taxa: Arkhangelskiella, Broinsonia, Thiersteinia,

Distinguishing features: Similar to Broinsonia but with well-developed central spine


    Daughter taxa: (blue => in age window 0-300Ma)
    Thiersteinia ecclesiastica

    Thiersteinia sp.
    Specimens not identified to species level

      Taxonomy:

      Citation: Thiersteinia Wise & Watkins in Wise, 1983
      Rank: Genus
      Type species: Thiersteinia ecclesiastica Wise & Watkins in Wise, 1983

      Farinacci & Howe catalog pages: Thiersteinia *

      Distinguishing features: Similar to Broinsonia but with well-developed central spine

      Geological Range:
      Last occurrence (top): within Coniacian Stage (86.26-89.77Ma, top in Coniacian stage). Data source: Total of range of species in this database
      First occurrence (base): within Turonian Stage (89.77-93.90Ma, base in Turonian stage). Data source: Total of range of species in this database

      Plot of occurrence data:

      • Range-bar - range as quoted above, pink interval top occurs in, green interval base occurs in.
      • Triangles indicate an event for which a precise placement has been suggested
      • Neptune data: This is a higher taxon page so Neptune data is not plotted. See also: customisable plot Parent: Arkhangelskiellaceae

      References:

      Burnett, J.A., (1998). Upper Cretaceous. In: Bown, P.R. (Editor), Calcareous Nannofossil Biostratigraphy. British Micropalaeontological Society Publications Series. Chapman & Hall, London, pp. 132-199.

      Wise, S.W., (1983). Mesozoic and Cenozoic calcareous nannofossils recovered by DSDP Leg 71 in the Falkland Plateau region, Southwest Atlantic Ocean. Initial Reports of the Deep Sea Drilling Project, 71: 481-550.

      Thiersteinia compiled by Jeremy R. Young, Paul R. Bown, Jacqueline A. Lees viewed: 30-9-2018
